The XML view of a JSP page obtained from the Page Data object while using a
TagLibraryvalidator class seems to have a syntax mismatch with the spec.
The problem areas are jsp:root element and the taglib directive declaration.
I am attaching the JSP as well as the XML output obtained.

---------

<%@ taglib uri=/tlds/TLVTest.tld" prefix="tlv" %>
<tlv:define id=intval scope="page" life="nested" />
</tlv:define>

creator: justyna.horwat@sun.com
text:
In a tag library tag, xmlns must be specified as:

<tagPrefix:tagname xmlns:tagPrefix="uri" ...>

where tagPrefix and uri are as specified in a directive.taglib. This allows both
Schema-validating parsers and parsers that are not namespace-aware to operate
properly.

As documented in Section B.1 and B.2 of the JSP 1.2 specification

Xml view of a JSP page now consistent with chapter 5 of the JSP1.2 
specification. 

Tag Library namespaces now added to <jsp:root> element. The 
<jsp:directive.taglib> element has been removed and will not be used.
